Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by:  Imam Izak-el Mu'eed Pasha, Masjid Malcolm Shabazz, 102 West 116th Street, New York, NY 10026.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Jackson.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Imam Izak-el Mu'eed Pasha, Masjid Malcolm Shabazz, 102 West 116th Street, New York, N.Y. 10026.

Council Member Jackson moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meetings of October 17 and October 23, 2007 be adopted and printed by Council Member Felder.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Felder moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of October 17 and October 23, 2007 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor
Communications from City, County & Borough Offices

Communication from the Brooklyn Borough President - Submitting the name of Shirley A. McRae to the Council for its advice and consent regarding her appointment to the New York City Planning Commission, for the remainder of a term which expires June 30, 2012, pursuant to Sections 31 and 192 (a) of the New York City Charter.

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Katz
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d (b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Applications no. C 060373 ZSM and shall be subject to Council review.  These items are related Uniform Land Use Procedure Application no. C 060372 ZMM.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, 122 E. 32nd Street, Manhattan (C060373ZSM)

Report of the Committee on Environmental Protection
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reducing greenhouse gas emissions.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Reducing the emission of global warming pollution.

Items.Title: Resolution finding that the enactment of Proposed Int. No. 20-A does not have a significant adverse impact on the environment and is consistent with The State Environmental Quality Review Act.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Reducing the emission of global warming pollution.

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to campaign finance.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Campaign Finance

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing the rates of horse drawn cabs.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Increasing the rates of horse drawn cabs.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the regulation of horse drawn cabs.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Inspection of horses, stables and cabs.

Items.Title: Resolution finding that the enactment of Proposed Int. No. 20-A does not have a significant adverse impact on the environment and is consistent with The State Environmental Quality Review Act.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Reducing the emission of global warming pollution.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting the manual transfer of diesel fuel and requiring all refilling of diesel fuel tanks inside of buildings above the lowest floor be accomplished only by using a transfer pump supplied from a primary storage tank.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting the manual transfer of diesel fuel.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to collective bargaining rights of department of environmental protection police officers.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Collective bargaining rights of department of environmental protection police officers.

Items.Title: Uniform Land Use Review Procedure application no. C 060372 ZMM, pursuant to Sections 197-c and 201 of the New York City Charter, for an amendment of the Zoning Map, Section No. 8d, changing from a C4-5A District to a C6-2A District property bounded by East 32nd Street, a line 100 feet westerly of Lexington Avenue, a line midway between East 31st Street and East 32nd Street, and a line 150 feet easterly of Park Avenue South.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: ULURP, E. 32nd Street Rezoning, Manhattan (C060372ZMM)

Items.Title: Uniform land use review procedure application no. C 060373 ZSM, pursuant to §197-c and §201 of the Charter of the City of New York for the grant of a special permit pursuant to Sections 13-562 and 74-52 of the Zoning Resolution in the Borough of Manhattan, Council District no. 2 to allow an attended public parking garage with a maximum capacity of 44 spaces on portions of the ground floor, cellar and subcellar of a proposed mixed use building on property located at 122 East 32nd Street (Block 887, Lots 84 and 87). This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if appealed to the Council pursuant to §197-d (b)(2) of the Charter or called up by vote of the Council pursuant to §197-d (b)(3) of the Charter.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the President, the U.S. Congress and the U.S. Department of Defense to rescind the current “Don’t Ask, Don’t Tell, Don’t Pursue” policy and allow lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgendered persons to serve openly in the military.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Veterans
Items.MatterName: Rescind the current “Don’t Ask, Don’t Tell, Don’t Pursue” policy and allow lesbian, gay and bisexual persons to serve openly in the military.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to amend the Penal Law to add etching, painting, drawing or otherwise placing or displaying a noose, a symbol of racism and intimidation, on a building or other real property to ways of committing aggravated harassment in the first degree.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Amend the Penal Law to add etching, painting, drawing or otherwise placing or displaying a noose, a symbol of racism and intimidation, on a building or other real property.

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - Withdrawing the nomination of Page Ayres Cowley (M 849) from the City Council for its advice and consent regarding her appointment to the Landmarks Preservation Commission.
Items.ActionName: Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.MatterName: M 849 - Page Ayres Cowley, Landmarks Preservation Commission

Items.MinutesNote: The presence of a quorum was announced by The Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum).
At this point the Speaker (Council Member Quinn) made the following annoucements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Quinn), the Clerk of the Council adjourned to meet again on December 11, 2007.

MICHAEL McSWEENEY, First Deputy City Clerk
Acting Clerk of the Council
